attributes.action: that disabled  Ex-Veteran, having served in Middle East - should not be living in 3rd worlds living conditions!!!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: My name is Frederick Nelson, I am aged 75 years old and have served in the Middle East Land Forces in the 1950's. I reside at 12, Lindisfarne Place, NE28 7EZ.  Both my carer and I are disabled and use electric wheelchairs.  With the support of Courts by Court Orders, who do not dispute our disabilities, that since 1996 have tried to get the property repaired/adapted.  We don’t have access to; a toilet, shower, bedroom, we eat, sleep excrete, urinate in commodes or urine bottle in the living room. Our personal care needs are met by a plastic bowl.  Despite having assessments for personal care, a.m./p.m., ironing, shopping, housework etc… we do not receive any of these. The property is damp and temperatures have dropped below 5 degrees Celsius and dont have carpets. North Tyneside are withholding repairs and adaptations unless Pat signs a waiver/disclaimer that NO-ONE accesses the property.In 2006 NTC contacted Quicksilver to remove household, then in 2008, Quicksilver disposed of these contents via Thomas Miller Auctioneers and disposed of 2.7 tonnes on a skip, because Quicksilver say Pat was liable for storage costs!!!

rejection.details: I would suggest that the e-petitions system is probably not the right avenue to highlight your case as it will not get a response unless it receives 500 or more signatures. It would be better to write to the PM (contact details can be found here: http://www.number10.gov.uk/footer/contact-us), contact your local MP/local council representative for help, or speak to an organisation such as the Citizens Advice Bureau.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
